original: Forsbom, John Isidor, apotekare, Huskvarna, f. 25/2/93 i Stora Tuna, Kopparb. 1., av dir. Ernst Viktor F. o. Hedvig Hagström. G. 26 m. Elin Holm. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 12, farm. kand. 22, apot:ex. 25. Elev v. Kronan i Upps. o. Enhörningen i Gbg 14-16, anst. v. apot. i Hjo, Oskarshamn, Göta Lejon i Kar Is kr.. Gripen i Ny köp. 30-34, Fenix i Nyköp. 34—40 varav ’Som förest, c :a ett år, priv. å apot. i Fjugesta 40, transp. t. apot. i Huskvarna 45. V. sekr. i Sv. farm:förb. sydöstra krets 27-28, v. ordf. 28-29, fullm. f. Sthlmis-krets. 35-37, f. Mälar-krets. 39, fullm :suppl. i Sv. apot:förb. 41. Var i Fjugesta led. av municip :-fullm. o. ordf. i bostadsbyggn :komm.
translated: Forsbom, John Isidor, pharmacist, from Huskvarna, born on February 25, 1893 in Stora Tuna, Kopparberg County. He was the son of director Ernst Viktor F. and Hedvig Hagström. He married Elin Holm in 1926. He obtained his high school diploma in Stockholm in 1912, a degree in pharmacy in 1922, and a pharmaceutical license in 1925. He trained at Kronan in Uppsala and Enhörningen in Gothenburg from 1914-1916, and then worked at pharmacies in Hjo, Oskarshamn, Göta Lejon in Karlskrona, Gripen in Nyköping from 1930-1934, and Fenix in Nyköping from 1934-1940, where he also served as the store manager for one year and had a brief period as a private pharmacist in Fjugesta in 1940. He moved to the pharmacy in Huskvarna in 1945. From 1927-1928, he was the vice-secretary of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association's southeast district, and from 1928-1929, the vice-chairman. From 1935-1937, he was a full-time member of the Stockholm district and from 1939, a member of the Mälar district. In 1941, he was a supplementary member of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association. In Fjugesta, he was a member of the municipal council and chairman of the housing construction committee.
